actor_awards.notes: A classically trained opera singer who became a top box-office star in MGM musicals.

filmography.title: Andy Hardy's Private Secretary
filmography.role_description: A young secretary with a beautiful singing voice who becomes involved in Andy Hardy's latest scheme; Grayson's film debut.
filmography.plot: Andy Hardy hires a secretary to help him with his student council duties, but complications arise when she fails her exams.

filmography.title: The Vanishing Virginian
filmography.role_description: The suffragette daughter of a local prosecutor in this historical drama based on a true story.
filmography.plot: A district attorney in Lynchburg, Virginia runs his family with a stern hand but struggles to adapt to the changing times.

filmography.title: Rio Rita
filmography.role_description: The owner of a hotel on the Mexican border who gets mixed up with Abbott and Costello and Nazi spies.
filmography.plot: Two bumbling drifters get hired at a hotel and uncover a plot by Nazi spies to smuggle bombs into the US.

filmography.title: Seven Sweethearts
filmography.role_description: The youngest of seven daughters in Little Delft, Michigan, who dreams of a singing career and romance.
filmography.plot: A reporter covers a tulip festival in Michigan and falls for the youngest daughter of a hotel owner who wants to marry off his eldest first.

filmography.title: Thousands Cheer
filmography.role_description: The daughter of an Army colonel who puts on a show for the troops and falls for a disgruntled aerialist (Gene Kelly).
filmography.plot: An acrobat joins the army and falls in love with the Colonel's daughter, culminating in a star-studded variety show for the troops.

filmography.title: Anchors Aweigh
filmography.role_description: An aspiring singer and aunt to a young Dean Stockwell who is pursued by two sailors (Gene Kelly and Frank Sinatra).
filmography.plot: Two sailors on a four-day shore leave in Hollywood meet a young singer and try to help her get an audition.

filmography.title: Ziegfeld Follies
filmography.role_description: Appears as herself in the opulent 'Beauty' finale segment, singing 'There's Beauty Everywhere'.
filmography.plot: From heaven, Florenz Ziegfeld recalls his greatest stars and introduces a series of musical and comedy numbers.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Win – Best Musical Comedy

filmography.title: Two Sisters from Boston
filmography.role_description: A proper Bostonian who secretly sings in a Bowery beer hall, causing a scandal for her family.
filmography.plot: Two sisters travel from Boston to New York, where one finds work in a burlesque show to pay for her opera training.

filmography.title: Till the Clouds Roll By
filmography.role_description: Portrays the 'Show Boat' character in a segment of this Jerome Kern biopic, singing 'Make Believe'.
filmography.plot: A musical biography of the life and career of composer Jerome Kern, featuring an all-star cast performing his songs.

filmography.title: It Happened in Brooklyn
filmography.role_description: A music teacher and aspiring opera singer who becomes the love interest of a returning GI (Frank Sinatra).
filmography.plot: A talented singer returns from the war to his Brooklyn neighborhood, trying to break into show business with the help of friends.

filmography.title: The Kissing Bandit
filmography.role_description: The daughter of the Spanish Governor of California who is courted by a reluctant bandit (Frank Sinatra).
filmography.plot: A timid young man returns to California to take over his father's business, only to find out his father was a notorious bandit.

filmography.title: That Midnight Kiss
filmography.role_description: A wealthy debutante who discovers a talented truck driver (Mario Lanza) and helps launch his opera career.
filmography.plot: A rich girl discovers a singing truck driver and brings him to the attention of her maestro grandfather.

filmography.title: The Toast of New Orleans
filmography.role_description: An opera star who is wooed by a rough bayou fisherman (Mario Lanza) who possesses a golden voice.
filmography.plot: A bayou fisherman with a great voice falls for an opera singer and follows her to New Orleans to learn how to sing.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Original Song ('Be My Love')

filmography.title: Grounds for Marriage
filmography.role_description: An opera singer who tries to win back her ex-husband, a doctor, before he marries someone else.
filmography.plot: A divorced opera singer tries to rekindle the romance with her doctor ex-husband, who is now engaged to another woman.

filmography.title: Show Boat
filmography.role_description: The innocent daughter of a riverboat captain who falls for a gambler and becomes a star; arguably her most famous role.
filmography.plot: The lives and loves of performers and workers on a Mississippi River show boat over 40 years.

filmography.title: Lovely to Look At
filmography.role_description: A pragmatic dress designer in Paris who falls for an American producer inheriting the shop.
filmography.plot: Three producers inherit a dress shop in Paris and try to save it from bankruptcy.

filmography.title: The Desert Song
filmography.role_description: A French general's daughter who falls in love with the mysterious leader of the Riff, 'The Red Shadow'.
filmography.plot: A professor leads a double life as a rebel leader fighting against a corrupt Yousseff in the Moroccan desert.

filmography.title: So This Is Love
filmography.role_description: The biographical role of Grace Moore, a small-town girl who becomes a star of the Metropolitan Opera and Broadway.
filmography.plot: The biography of opera singer Grace Moore, tracing her rise from a church choir to international stardom.

filmography.title: Kiss Me Kate
filmography.role_description: A temperamental diva who battles her ex-husband on and off stage in a musical version of 'The Taming of the Shrew'.
filmography.plot: Divorced actors Fred and Lilli are reunited for a musical adaptation of 'The Taming of the Shrew,' where their onstage battles mirror their offstage relationship.

filmography.title: The Vagabond King
filmography.role_description: A French noblewoman who aids the poet-thief François Villon in his fight against the Burgundians; Grayson's final film role.
filmography.plot: Poet and thief François Villon helps King Louis XI fight against the Duke of Burgundy.

filmography.title: That's Entertainment!
filmography.role_description: Grayson appears as a narrator and is featured in clips celebrating the golden age of MGM musicals.
filmography.plot: A documentary celebrating the 50th anniversary of MGM, featuring clips from its most famous musical films.

filmography.title: That's Entertainment! II
filmography.role_description: Featured in archive footage celebrating the legacy of the MGM musical.
filmography.plot: A second compilation of musical and comedy numbers from the golden age of MGM.

filmography.title: That's Entertainment! III
filmography.role_description: Featured in additional recovered footage from the MGM vault.
filmography.plot: The third installment in the series, featuring behind-the-scenes footage and cut musical numbers.

filmography.title: The Amazing World of Photography
filmography.role_description: An appearance in a short documentary film showcasing photography techniques.
filmography.plot: A documentary short exploring the uses of photography in various fields.

filmography.title: Some of the Best
filmography.role_description: A promotional film celebrating MGM's 25th anniversary, featuring its roster of stars.
filmography.plot: A compilation film highlighting the history and stars of Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer.
